Article Title: Kerala nonagenarian dies soon after casting vote at home
Article Text: KOTTAYAM: A 99-year-old man died soon after casting his vote in Lok Sabha polls at home in Kerala 's Kottayam district, family members said on Sunday.The deceased man, A K Raman Nair, was a native of Manakkunnu in Pala here. He had been suffering from age-related ailments for some time and died within minutes after exercising his franchise on Saturday as part of the vote-from-home facility launched by the Election Commission, they said.Nair, who had been living with his grandson, was discharged from the hospital two days ago. The polling officials went with the ballot paper when the nonagenarian man was having lunch. Despite health issues, he was excited to cast his vote and breathed his last soon after the process, the family added.
Article Summary: The deceased man, A K Raman Nair, was a native of Manakkunnu in Pala here. He had been suffering from age-related ailments for some time. He died within minutes after exercising his franchise on Saturday.

Article Title: 'Whatever he says is blessing': Tejashwi responds to Nitish's 'too many kids' comment
Article Text:
Paida to bahut kar diya...Itna jyada paida karna chahiye kisi ko, bal bachcha

NEW DELHI: A day after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar took an apparent dig on Lalu Yadav for having "too many kids", RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav responded on Sunday saying that he had "all respect for Nitish Kumar" adding that whatever he says "we see it as a blessing"."I said this yesterday as well, we have all respect for Nitish Kumar. Whatever he says for our family, we see it as a blessing but these are personal things and won't be benefitting the people.This Lok Sabha election is going on and there is no benefit to the people of Bihar and the country by talking about all these things. This is a personal matter," he said.Referring to Nitish as his "uncle", Tejashwi said, "Now, the situation is that 4-5 people have hijacked our uncle (Nitish Kumar), and when the time comes I'll write a book, I'll explain all these things. It's not the first time that he has said this, he said this in the 2020 elections as well."Tejashwi was addressing a press conference after Lok Janshakti Party leader and Katihar MP Choudhary Mehboob Ali Kaiser joined RJD."I can only pray that his health remains good and he lives happily. It's not in our culture that we say something to someone who is a father figure to us," he added.Nitish Kumar on Saturday made a veiled remark on Lalu Yadav stirring political slugfest. "(Should anybody have so many children)?", he said.Nitish Kumar, is participating in the Lok Sabha elections as part of the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA).
Article Summary: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav responded on Sunday saying that he had "all respect for Nitish Kumar" "Whatever he says for our family, we see it as a blessing but these are personal things," he said.Nitish Kumar on Saturday made a veiled remark on Lalu Yadav stirring political slugfest.

Article Title: 'No courage to ...': PM Modi's Rajya Sabha dig at Sonia Gandhi
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday took a subtle dig at former Congress president Sonia Gandhi , suggesting that some leaders have lost the courage to contest elections While addressing a rally at Nanded in Maharashtra, without taking names, the Prime Minister said some INDIA bloc leaders who have been members of the Lok Sabha for several years, have left the Lower House of Parliament and found a seat in the Rajya Sabha as they have no confidence to contest elections."Whatever claims these people make, the truth is that Congress leaders have already accepted defeat even before the announcement of elections. This is the very reason that a few of their leaders, who used to contest and win Lok Sabha seats, have this time entered through the Rajya Sabha route," PM Modi said."For the first time, the family will not vote for a Congress candidate in the constituency where they live as there is no party candidate there," he added.Senior Congress leader Sonia Gandhi was elected unopposed to Rajya Sabha from Rajasthan. This is her first stint in the Upper House after serving 6 terms in Lok Sabha. This is will be the first time that Sonia would not contest in the Lok Sabha election since entering politics nearly two-and-a-half decades ago.Sonia had penned a letter to the voters of Rae Bareli announcing that she will not contest Lok Sabha polls due to health concerns. Sonia has won the Rae Bareli seat five times since 1999. In 2019, Rae Bareli was the only seat won by Congress in Uttar Pradesh.PM Modi also targeted Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, predicting that he will lose the Wayanad seat. "After losing Amethi, the Congress' Sahabzade will lose Wayanad as well. So he will have to look for a safe seat after April 26," he said.The Prime Minister criticized the opposition's INDIA bloc, stating that the alliance lacks a face to project and that people are uncertain about entrusting the country's future to them.He described the alliance as a group of selfish individuals who have united to protect their corrupt practices. PM Modi pointed out that the INDIA bloc partners were fighting each other for 25 per cent of the Lok Sabha seats, questioning their ability to govern effectively after the election."If this is the situation now, what will they do after the election?" PM Modi said.The Prime Minister appealed to voters to come out in large numbers to exercise their voting right in the Lok Sabha elections.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a subtle dig at former Congress president Sonia Gandhi. PM Modi said some INDIA bloc leaders who have been members of the Lok Sabha for several years, have left the Lower House of Parliament and found a seat in the Rajya Sabha.

Article Text: NEW DELHI: The visual makeover for Doordarshan 's news channels marked by a change in the colour of its logo from red to orange has sparked a controversy , with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and I&B minister locking horns over what the opposition called an attempt to "saffronise" the national broadcaster.Mamata slammed the move calling it "absolutely unethical, grossly illegal, and speaks loudly of the pro-BJP bias of the national public broadcaster" and demanded Election Commission's intervention.I&B minister Anurag Thakur, however, shrugged off the charge and suggested that Mamata's stand was in keeping with her resistance to "anything saffron ".Prasar Bharti CEO Gaurav Dwivedi also pushed against the charge saying, "No surprises there, your love for 'saffron' is publicly known :) Didi, Bharat Mata ki Jai." He argued that the move was meant for visual enhancement and the colour that has raised hackles is, in fact, orange and not saffron as being alleged.Congress MP and former I&B minister Manish Tewari criticised the switch saying it was a move to assert BJP govt's control over the public broadcaster. "This is an attempt on the part of the govt to saffronise and capture the govt institutions. The said move clearly undermines the neutrality and credibility of India's public broadcaster," he wrote on X.TMC MP Jawahar Sircar, who served as CEO of Prasar Bharati, also criticised the alleged saffronisation of the national broadcaster saying, "As ex-CEO of Prasar Bharati it hurts to see the saffronisation of Doordarshan's logo - just before elections! It will influence voters, by overlaying the colour one religion and Sangh Parivar colour with a 'neutral' Public Broadcaster and a biassed Govt/Regime."Dwivedi, however, argued that the adoption of a vibrant, visually appealing colour was part of the channel's branding and aesthetic upgrade. "The colour is orange, not saffron," he clarified, further explaining, "It's not just the logo that underwent change, the entire visual identity has been revamped. It's regrettable that people are reading more into this than necessary. We've been working on revitalising DD's look and feel for the past six to eight months."Established on Sept 15, 1959, the national broadcaster had its logo designed by Devashish Bhattacharya, a student of the National Institute of Design.Contrary to political speculations, the broadcaster clarified that the colour change is rooted in the logo's history and aesthetic appeal. It pointed out that the original logo, chosen by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and introduced in 1976 along with theme music composed by Pandit Ravi Shankar and Ustad Ali Ahmed Hussain Khan, featured an orange hue against a green backdrop.The vice-president of Andhra BJP, Vishnu Vardhan Reddy attacked the critics saying, "When #Doordarshan was launched in 1959, it had a saffron logo. Now, as the govt reintroduces the original logo, liberals and #Congress are outraging over it. It's blatantly obvious they harbour hate against 'Bhagwa' and Hindus."
Article Summary: Mamata Banerjee and I&B minister Anurag Thakur lock horns over colour of Doordarshan's logo. Opposition calls it an attempt to "saffronise" the national broadcaster. Prasar Bharti CEO Gaurav Dwivedi says the colour is orange and not saffron.

Article Title: After Amethi, 'shehzada' will flee Wayanad too, taunts PM Modi
Article Text: CHHATRAPATI SAMBHAJINAGAR: PM Narendra Modi took a swipe at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi at a campaign rally on Saturday, saying after Amethi, " Congress shehzada " will have to "run away" from Wayanad as well. The PM was in Maharashtra and Karnataka to campaign for BJP and NDA candidates ."Shehzada is facing a difficult situation in Wayanad. Shehzada and his gang are waiting for polling on April 26 to get over so that they can find another safe seat for him.Their own alliance partners are abusing the shehzada in Wayanad. And they are using such abusive language against him, which even I have not used against him," Modi said in Nanded. He addressed two public rallies, one each in Nanded and Parbhani districts of Maharashtra.He mentioned that surveys indicated a favourable voting pattern for NDA in the first phase of Lok Sabha elections held Friday and dismissed INDIA bloc as unable to pose a challenge.Modi highlighted internal conflicts within the opposition alliance, stating that some INDIA bloc politicians are not actively campaigning for their candidates. "There are 25% seats, where the alliance is facing infighting and even talking about putting their partners in prison," he said.In Parbhani, the PM criticised Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance in Maharashtra, accusing Congress and the "fake Shiv Sena" of neglecting sadhus killed in Palghar.During a rally in Chikkaballapura, 60km from Bengaluru, which marked the PM's fourth appearance in Karnataka this election season, Modi said "big and influential" figures, both within India and abroad, have aligned to oust him from office. He expressed his gratitude for the "protective shield" he gets from "Nari Shakti" (women empowerment) and "Maatru Shakti" (motherly power), enabling him to confront and overcome challenges.In an interview with a regional Malayalam television channel, Modi reiterated his plans to intervene in the Karuvannur Cooperative Bank scam, while denying allegations of political use of central agencies. He reaffirmed his commitment to combating corruption through agencies like ED and CBI.He blamed Congress for the water crisis in Marathwada region of Maharashtra and in Karnataka. Referring to the water crisis in parts of Bengaluru, Modi accused Congress govt of turning the tech city into a "tanker city" and allowing the tanker mafia to thrive.(Inputs from Bengaluru, Thiruvananthapuram)
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi was in Maharashtra and Karnataka to campaign for BJP and NDA candidates. He addressed two public rallies, one each in Nanded and Parbhani districts of Maharashtra. He blamed Congress for the water crisis in Marathwada region of Maharashtra and in Karnataka.

Article Title: Lok Sabha polls: FIR lodged against DK Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and Karnataka BJP chief B Y Vijayendra
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Election Commission of Karnataka announced on Saturday that First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered against prominent Karnataka politicians, including deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and state BJP chief B Y Vijayendra, for various alleged violations related to the ongoing Lok Sabha elections.According to posts on social media platform X by the chief electoral officer of Karnataka, FIRs have been lodged against these politicians.According to the EC , Shivakumar allegedly violated the MCC while addressing apartment owners in RR Nagara in the run-up to the Lok Sabha elections. The FIR has filed under Section 171 (B)(C)(E)(F) of IPC for "bribery and undue influence" at elections.HD Kumaraswamy, on the other hand, has been accused of making false statements in connection with the elections.B Y Vijayendra, the state BJP chief, has been charged with posting derogatory content against the Congress from the official X handle of the Karnataka BJP.The polling in Karnataka for the 28 seats to the 18th Lok Sabha will be held on April 26 and May 7 in the second and third phases respectively.The counting of votes will take place on June 4.
Article Summary: First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered against prominent Karnataka politicians. They include deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and state BJP chief B Y Vijayendra. According to posts on social media platform X, FIRs have been lodged against these politicians.

Article Title: 'BJP trying to silence opposition': Priyanka Chaturvedi ahead of INDIA bloc's 'Ulgulan rally'
Article Text: RANCHI: Ahead of the INDIA bloc's ' Nyay Ulgulan Rally ' today, which means uprising, Shiv Sina (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi accused the BJP of trying to silence opposition leaders and said that the opposition leaders are together in the ruling party's growing autocracy .The grand rally being held amidst the Lok Sabha polls would be themed around the arrest of the ex-Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren and the AAP's Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, two of the key faces of the INDIA bloc.Both Hemant Soren and Kejriwal are in judicial custody."My message is very clear: we are together in this fight against the BJP's growing autocracy. They are not allowing the opposition to function properly; what they are trying to do is silence the opposition," she said.Hitting out at the BJP-led central government, the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said, "We are seeing a high rate of inflation, joblessness and women not getting a safe environment. In the first phase of the election, not many people, but those who have come out to vote have come out to change these people (BJP), who have been showing this dictatorial tendency."Posters of INDIA bloc leaders, including Congress Parliamentary party chairperson Sonia Gandhi, party MP Rahul Gandhi, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, former Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren and his wife Kalpana Soren, have been put up in Ranchi ahead of the mega rally scheduled at Prabhat Tara Ground.Samajwadi Party national president Akhilesh Yadav will also participate in the rally.Apart from SP chief, other INDIA bloc leaders will also participate in today's rally. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's wife, Sunita Kejriwal, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and AAP leader Sanjay Singh will join the "Nyay Ulgulan Rally."The election for the 14 Lok Sabha constituencies of Jharkhand is yet to begin in the fourth phase of the general polls. Jharkhand will go to the polls in the fourth, fifth, sixth and seventh phases.During the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) won a total of 12 seats in Jharkhand, with the BJP alone winning 11 seats.The Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Congress got one seat each.
Article Summary: India bloc's'Nyay Ulgulan Rally'today, which means uprising. Rally themed around arrest of ex-Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren and AAP's Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, two of the key faces of the INDIA bloc.

Article Title: Blast near BJP booth chief's house in Bengal
Article Text: RANAGHAT: A bomb exploded in front of a BJP booth president's house in Ranaghat in Bengal's Nadia district on Friday night, prompting the saffron party to blame Trinamool workers for the blast.The victim, Kalyan Ghosh , alleged that TMC councillor Joydeep Dutta masterminded the blast. "Three TMC men fled away when people came out hearing the blast," he said.BJP on Saturday lodged a complaint with Election Commission, but TMC denied the charge.BJP supporters mobbed Ranaghat police station, demanding immediate arrest of the culprits.
Article Summary: A bomb exploded in front of a BJP booth president's house in Ranaghat in Bengal's Nadia district on Friday night. The victim, Kalyan Ghosh, alleged that TMC councillor Joydeep Dutta masterminded the blast. TMC denied the charge.

Article Title: 2 more Punjab Congress ministers join BJP
Article Text: Congress in Punjab suffered yet another setback ahead of Lok Sabha elections in the state with the wife of former MP Santokh Singh Chaudhary , Karmjeet Kaur Chaudhary, joining BJP on Saturday. Santokh passed away during Rahul Gandhi 's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Punjab in 2023. Tajinder Bittu, AICC secretary in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, also joined BJP on Saturday.Bittu was a close aide of Priyanka Gandhi and former chairman of Jalandhar Improvement Trust.BJP, which is contesting the polls in the border state solo, further bolstered its chances with joining of the two leaders.Bittu announced his resignation from Congress hours before joining BJP. He and Karamjit Kaur Chaudhary joined BJP in the presence of Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and its national general secretary Vinod Tawde.
Article Summary: Santokh Singh Chaudhary's wife Karmjeet joins BJP. Tajinder Bittu, AICC secretary in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, also joined BJP. Santokh passed away during Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Punjab in 2023.

Article Title: Congress-SP wiped out in UP in first phase of Lok Sabha polls: Amit Shah
Article Text: AGRA/JAIPUR/KOTA/BHILWARA: Union home minister Amit Shah claimed at a large election rally in support of BJP's Mathura candidate Hema Malini in Vrindavan on Saturday that "Congress and SP" had been "wiped out in the first phase" in Uttar Pradesh."In 2017, two princes had come together... They have come together in 2024 as well, (but) BJP will win maximum seats in the state," Shah said in reference to Congress's Rahul Gandhi and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav.In Kota, Rajasthan, Shah said if people had voted for Congress in 2019, Kota would have become a bastion for Popular Front of India (PFI), an oblique reference to the banned outfit's foundation day rally in 2022. Alleging that Congress will lift the ban on PFI if it is elected to office, Shah asked, "Ban on PFI should continue or not?"The question was answered with a resounding "Yes". Kota goes to polls in the second phase on April 26."Your vote for BJP should be for decisive actions such as the scrapping of Article 370, ending terrorism, fighting Naxalism, and building the Ram temple in Ayodhya. This is why we have to vote for Modi," he said.Shah referred to Congress as "Sardar of Falsehood" and accused it of misleading the country by stating that BJP is seeking 400 seats to scrap reservation. "You gave us majority in 2014 and 2019, we didn't use it to scrap reservation but to scrap Article 370, build the Ram temple, and bring CAA to grant citizenship to persecuted Hindus, Sikhs, and Buddhists," he said.In Vrindavan, Shah accused Congress and SP of involvement in scams and corruption worth Rs 12 lakh crore and contrasted their alleged malfeasance with PM Narendra Modi 's "unblemished" record. Mathura also goes to polls in the second phase on April 26.Shah also took potshots at Rahul Gandhi for his allegedly frequent trips to Thailand, a point he had raised at a public rally in Pali on Friday as well. Extending his jab to include AICC general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Shah suggested that the Gandhis couldn't bear the heat of Indian summers and opted for vacations abroad, most recently to Thailand. "On the one hand, we have a leadership that goes to Thailand, while on the other hand PM Modi has worked hard for past 23 years without a break," Shah said.He warned Congress of serious repercussions if the party plans to alter the reservation system. "Rahul Baba, don't spread lies, and listen to me with an open ear. If the Congress party wants to scrap reservation, as long as a BJP worker is alive, they would never allow reservation to SC/ST, OBC to be scrapped, and it is Modi's guarantee', Shah said.
Article Summary: Union home minister Amit Shah claimed at a large election rally in support of BJP's Mathura candidate Hema Malini in Vrindavan on Saturday that "Congress and SP" had been "wiped out in the first phase" in Uttar Pradesh. Shah also took potshots at Rahul Gandhi for his allegedly frequent trips to Thailand.

Article Title: Lok Sabha election turnout dips in Madhya Pradesh, a first in 2 decades
Article Text: The 2024 Lok Sabha election has begun with a puzzle - voting percentage has dropped for the first time in a LS poll in Madhya Pradesh in two decades, but neither BJP nor Congress seem worried.The nearly 8% plunge in MP polling is far steeper than the national average drop this time.Over past 20 years, Congress has had a stable 35% vote share in parliamentary elections while BJP has 55%.There are 7% fence-sitters who may go either way. Going by the turnout , either BJP has failed to achieve the 370-plus target or Congress's 35% vote share has been encroached upon.State BJP media cell chief Ashish Agarwal said, "BJP's vote share is continuously growing in MP. The drop in turnout is because Congress' voters did not come out."PCC chief spokesman Abbas Hafeez countered, "Congress sees this drop positively. It shows that the wave is now going against BJP."But former CEC OP Rawat feels weather was a factor: " Heat makes it difficult for voters to step out."
Article Summary: The nearly 8% plunge in MP polling is far steeper than the national average drop this time. Over past 20 years, Congress has had a stable 35% vote share in parliamentary elections while BJP has 55%. There are 7% fence-sitters who may go either way.

Article Title: Jio: Reliance Jio launches 5G services in 50 more cities; total number hits 184
Article Text: MUMBAI: Reliance Jio on Tuesday announced the largest launch of its True 5G services across 50 cities in the country. With this, Jio users across 184 cities are now enjoying the fifth-generation mobile services.According to the company's statement, these 50 cities are in states including Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu.Jio users in these cities will be invited to the Jio Welcome Offer to experience unlimited data at up to 1 Gbps speeds at no additional cost, starting on Tuesday, the statement said.Jio spokesperson said, "We are thrilled to launch Jio True 5G services in 50 additional cities across 17 states and Union Territories, taking the total count to 184 cities. This is by far one of the largest rollouts of 5G services, not just in India, but anywhere in the world.""We have stepped up the speed and intensity of True 5G roll-out across the nation because we want every Jio user to enjoy the transformational benefits of Jio True 5G technology in the new year 2023. The entire nation will be able to enjoy and benefit from Jio True 5G services by December 2023," the spokesperson said.The cities of Chittoor, Kadapa, Narasaraopet, Ongole, Rajamahendravaram, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram in Andhra Pradesh; Nagaon in Assam; Bilaspur, Korba and Rajnandgaon in Chhattisgarh; Panaji in Goa; Ambala, Bahadurgarh, Hisar, Karnal, Panipat, Rohtak, Sirsa and Sonipat in Haryana, have access to Jio 5G services now, according to the statement. It also added that Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij inaugurated Jio True 5G in Haryana circle on Tuesday.Jio 5G services are now also live in Dhanbad in Jharkhand; Bagalkote, Chikkamagaluru, Hassan, Mandya and Tumakuru in Karnataka; Alappuzha in Kerala; Kolhapur, Nanded-Waghala, Sangli in Maharashtra; Balasore, Baripada, Bhadrak, Jharsuguda, Puri and Sambalpur in Odisha, the statement said.The cities in Puducherry; Amritsar, Bikaner, Kota in Rajasthan; Dharmapuri, Erode and Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu; Nalgonda in Telangana, and Jhansi, Aligarh, Moradabad, Saharanpur in Uttar Pradesh, and Asansol and Durgapur in West Bengal now have access to Jio 5G services. According to the statement, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will inaugurate Jio True 5G in Kota.The spokesperson also said, "We are grateful to the State Governments of Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal for their continuous support in our quest to digitise every region."
Article Summary: With this, Jio users across 184 cities are now enjoying the fifth-generation mobile services. These 50 cities are in states including Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu.

Article Title: Deepfake video of Ranveer Singh criticising government goes viral: Watch the original clip
Article Text:
Aamir Khan files FIR against fake video

Deepfakes, or digitally altered video and photos, have started to crop up online as India prepares to vote in the Lok Sabha elections 2024 from April 19. Following a fake video of Bollywood actor Aamir Khan endorsing a political party made rounds on the internet, a digitally manipulated clip of actor Ranveer Singh is being shared online.In the video, the actor is shown criticising Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP government at the centre, at the same time seeking votes for Congress.The video ends with Singh urging voters to vote for “nyaay” and the tagline 'Vote For Congress ' is seen flashing on the screen.It doesn’t take a second look to identify that the video is doctored. The lip movements of the actor in the video clearly doesn't match the audio. Notably, it is an old video shot when the actor visited Kashi, and in fact praised PM Modi for changing the face of the 'City of Ghats'.In the original video, Singh says, “I cannot express in words the experience that I have had today. I have been a devotee of lord Shiva and I have come here for the first time…” Here’s the original video:Recently, Aamir Khan filed an FIR against a deepfake video that showed him endorsing a specific political party. The actor’s office strongly denied any connection to politics or affiliation with any political party and issued a statement.“We want to clarify [that] Aamir Khan has never endorsed any political party in his 35-year career. He has dedicated his efforts to raising public awareness through campaigns for the Election Commission for many past elections,” the actor’s office said in the statement, as per news agency ANI.“We are alarmed now to see a recent viral video alleging Mr Khan is promoting a particular party. He would like to clarify [that] this is a fake and totally untrue video. He has reported the matter to various authorities, including filing an FIR with the Cyber Crime Cell of Mumbai Police,” the statement added.A video appears to be from his TV show “Satyamev Jayate,” that aired almost a decade ago.
Article Summary: Deepfakes, or digitally altered video and photos, have started to crop up online as India prepares to vote in the Lok Sabha elections 2024 from April 19. Aamir Khan filed an FIR against a deepfake video that showed him endorsing a specific political party.
